title: Mobile Public Service Programme operated by the Ministry of Urban Development, Construction and Housing
decision_details: - It has been identified that people living in rural areas and underserved urban areas face severe difficulties in resolving issues related to land use, obtaining building permits, inadequate housing facilities, infrastructure development and water supply services. The Ministry of Urban Development, Construction and Housing has planned to initiate and implement a mobile public service program, enabling the general public to easily obtain those services. The proposed program is expected to provide opportunity for the public to directly contact the officials of the institutions functioning under the Ministry, including the National Community Water Supply Department, the National Physical Planning Department, the Urban Development Authority, the Urban Settlement Development Authority, the National Housing Development Authority, the National Water Supply and Drainage Board, the Sri Lanka Land Development Corporation, the Condominium Management Authority and the Construction Industry Development Authority, to obtain solutions to the issues arising in relation to services related to the scope of the said institutions. Accordingly, the proposal made by the Minister of Urban Development, Construction and Housing to implement the proposed Mobile Public Service Program, was approved by the Cabinet.
